p: 1967â€“1968, SIEGERT, MARTINI, HENNESSEN, STILLE et al.: three clusters of Marburg haemorrhagic fever cases (31 patients, 7 died) in pharmaceutical laboratories in Germany (Behringwerke AG in Marburg, and also Frankfurt) and in Serbia (Beograd) that were acquired from rhesus monkeys imported from Uganda in 1967.
